title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The first point is earned for a correct ratio; the limit and absolute value are not required for the first point.

The second point requires appearance of absolute value and use of limit notation. Incorrect mathematical notation such as use of 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaicdaaeaaca aIWaaaaaaa@34B8@ or ∞ ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqcaaCaaiabg6HiLc qaaiabg6HiLcaaaaa@36EF@ in an equation impacts this point.

The third point may be earned with an incorrect limit evaluation provided the limit is nonzero and does not produce a trivial result for the radius of convergence.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response requires use of correct or consistent R MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGsbaaaa@340B@ from part (a).

One point is earned for a conclusion of diverges with an incomplete justification (e.g., reference to the harmonic series without connection to the appropriate test). “Diverges” alone does not earn a point. A conclusion of conditional or absolute convergence earns no points.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include an answer of diverges, with correct justification.
The student response accurately includes an answer of diverges, with partially-correct justification (e.g., reference to the harmonic series without connection to the appropriate test).
The student response accurately includes an answer of diverges, with correct justification.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The response requires use of correct or consistent −R MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaWGsbaaaa@34F8@ from part (a).

To earn both points, the response must present a correct reason for each series with justification and state that the given series converges conditionally.

To be eligible for one point, both series must have correct reasons and one missing/insufficient/incorrect justification OR one correct reason for one series with justification; the other reason is missing or has insufficient justification. A response is also eligible for one point if both reasons are “converge” or both reasons are “diverge,” and there is a consistent conclusion.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include an answer of converges conditionally, with correct justification.
The student response accurately includes an answer of converges conditionally, with partially-correct justification.
The student response accurately includes an answer of converges conditionally, with correct justification.

title: Part D
